executable.title: Bayesian Tissue Classifier
executable.description: This module aims to extract the major brain tissues mask. This tool was intensively tested with T1 MRI images, but the pipeline could be applied to any other structural MRI image. Here, it is applied a simple image processing pipeline based on voxel intensity segmentation in order to offer a simple brain tissue segmentation.
executable.contributor: Antonio Carlos da S. Senra Filho (University of Sao Paulo)
executable.acknowledgements: This work was partially funded by CNPq grant ...

image.name: inputVolume
image.label: Input Volume
image.description: Input volume. The algorithm works better with high resolution T1 MRI images alread brain extract and inhomogeneity corrected.

string-enumeration.name: imageModality
string-enumeration.description: Select the image modality inserted as a input volume.
string-enumeration.label: Image Modality

string.name: inputPriorsFile
string.label: Input Priors Probability
string.description: The probability priors for the input image. If this is empty, the naive Bayes classification is performed

integer.name: numberOfTissues
integer.label: Number of Tissues
integer.description: Defines the number of tissues found in the input image. NOTE: The background is also counted as a single tissue.

integer-vector.name: labelsDefinition
integer-vector.label: Labels Definition
integer-vector.description: Defines the values adopted for each label. The values will follow an ascendenting order. NOTE: The background value is always maintaned as zero!

parameters.label: Tissue Type Output
parameters.description: Parameters to be applied on the brain segmentation procedure.

boolean.name: oneTissue
boolean.description: Choose if you want all the tissues classes or only one class segmented.
boolean.label: Separate one tissue class

integer.name: typeTissue
integer.label: Tissue Value
integer.description: Choose what is the brain tissue label that you want as the output label. The order is always from the darkest to the brightest tissue in the image.
